H0.text: Sounds are fluids that travel through air, which explain the sound Paul hears when listening to music through his radio.

H1.text: Sounds are waves that travel through matter explains the sound Paul hears when he listens to music through his radio.

H2.text: Sounds are gases that transform into vibrations is the best explanation for the sound Paul hears while listening to music through his radio.

H3.text: Sounds are forms of energy that are converted from light when Paul listens to music through his radio.

A4.text: Sound is an example of a longitudinal wave.

A5.text: In physics, a mechanical wave is a wave that is an oscillation of matter, and therefore transfers energy through a material medium.
